name: Vegetables in Chickpea flour Sauce - Sindhi Kadhi Recipe
description: Vegetables in Chickpea flour Sauce - Sindhi Kadhi Recipe. Indian Spiced Vegetables in chickpea flour curry..No Onion No Garlic
recipeIngredient: 1/8 tsp asafetida hing (omit to make gluten-free or use a certified gluten-free asafetida)
3.5 cups of water (room temperature or luke warm)
1.5 to 2 cups small chopped veggies (potatoes, green beans, carrots, cauliflower etc)
2 to 3 tsp tamarind paste  (or 1 to 2 tbsp tamarind pulp, dry tamarind pods soaked in hot water, pulp reserved and the seeds removed)
1/2 tsp lime juice or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil over medium heat in a saucepan. When the oil is hot, add cumin and fenugreek seeds and cook until they change color and get fragrant. Stir frequently. 1 to 2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil over medium heat in a saucepan. When the oil is hot, add cumin and fenugreek seeds and cook until they change color and get fragrant. Stir frequently. 1 to 2 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add asafetida and curry leaves carefully. Once the sputtering has died down, add ginger and green chili and cook for a minute. Add the chickpea flour and mix in. Roast the chickpea flour for 3 to 4 minutes, stir every minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Add asafetida and curry leaves carefully. Once the sputtering has died down, add ginger and green chili and cook for a minute. Add the chickpea flour and mix in. Roast the chickpea flour for 3 to 4 minutes, stir every minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Add turmeric, cayenne and 1 cup of water and mix in. Use a whisk if needed. Mix until all of the chickpea flour is well dissolved and there are no lumps.
recipeInstructions.name: Add turmeric, cayenne and 1 cup of water and mix in. Use a whisk if needed. Mix until all of the chickpea flour is well dissolved and there are no lumps.

recipeInstructions.text: Add rest of the water, salt, veggies, Mix, cover and cook over medium heat for 17 to 18 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add rest of the water, salt, veggies, Mix, cover and cook over medium heat for 17 to 18 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the tomatoes, tamarind, lime juice and mix in. Reduce heat to medium low. Partially cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Taste and adjust salt, tang and heat. Add a dash of sugar or jaggery if needed and mix in. Serve over rice, with roasted potatoes, or as a soup.
